questions.description: Which of the following statements is/are correct ?

options.description: Aldehydes are generally oxidised under vigorous conditions
Ketones are easily oxidised to carboxylic acids even under mild oxidising agents
Oxidation of ketones involves carbon-carbon bond cleavage to give a mixture of carboxylic acids having lesser number of c-atoms than the parent ketones

questions.description: Arrange the following compound in boiling point order:
Addition of NaHSO₃ is used for :
If carbonyl compound react with primary amine then product is :
Brady reagent is used for identification of :
When aldehyde react with fehling solution then red brown ppt obtained due to :
Carboxylic acid react with :
When HCN react with carbonyl compound then product is known as :
When secondary amine react with carbonyl compound then product is known as :
When 1-mole of alochol react with aldehyde carbonyl compound then product is known as :
When cyclohexanecarbaldehyde reacts with which following reagents then reaction is known as clemenson reduction :

options.description: Zinc amalgam and dilute hydrochloric acid

questions.description: Which of the following compounds would undergo aldol condensation :
Which of the following compounds would undergo the Cannizzaro reaction :

Arrange the following compounds in decreasing order of reactivity towards HCN
Acetaldehyde, Acetone, Di-tert-butyl ketone, Methyl tert-butyl ketone

options.description: Acetaldehyde > Acetone > Methyl tert-butyl ketone > Di-tert-butyl ketone
Acetaldehyde < Acetone < Methyl tert-butyl ketone < Di-tert-butyl ketone
Di-tert-butyl ketone > Acetone > Methyl tert-butyl ketone > Acetaldehyde
Methyl tert-butyl ketone < Acetaldehyde < Acetone < Di-tert-butyl ketone

questions.description: Give simple chemical tests to distinguish between Propanal and Propanone.
Give simple chemical tests to distinguish between Acetophenone and Benzophenone.
Give simple chemical tests to distinguish between Ethanal and Propanal.
The correct order of increasing acidic strength is ______ .

options.description: Phenol < Ethanol < Chloroacetic acid < Acetic acid
Ethanol < Phenol < Chloroacetic acid < Acetic acid
Ethanol < Phenol < Acetic acid < Chloroacetic acid
Chloroacetic acid < Acetic acid < Phenol < Ethanol

questions.description: The reagent which does not react with both acetone and benzaldehyde :
Which of the following compounds will give butanone on oxidation with alkaline KMnO₄ solution :
In Clemmensen Reduction carbonyl compound is treated with ______ .

Statement (I) : Formaldehyde is a planar molecule.
Statement (II) : It contains sp² hybridised carbon atom.

options.description: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct and Statement (II) is the correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct but Statement (II) is not the correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are not correct.
Statement (I) is not correct but Statement (II) is correct.

questions.description:
Statement (I) : Compounds containing –CHO group are easily oxidised to corresponding carboxylic acids.
Statement (II) : Carboxylic acids can be reduced to alcohols by treatment with LiAlH₄.

options.description: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct and Statement (II) is the correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct but Statement (II) is not the correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are not correct.
Statement (I) is not correct but Statement (II) is correct.

questions.description:
Statement (I) : The α-hydrogen atom in carbonyl compounds is less acidic.
Statement (II) : The anion formed after the loss of α-hydrogen atom is resonance stabilised.

options.description: Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct and Statement (II) is the correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are correct but Statement (II) is not the correct explanation of Statement (I)
Both Statement (I) and Statement (II) are not correct.
Statement (I) is not correct but Statement (II) is correct.

questions.description: Salicyladehyde organic compound which give fragrance and flavour, obtain from which species.

options.description: The carbonyl carbon atom is sp²-hydridised
p-orbital of C-atom forms π-bond with O-atom by overlap with p-orbital of an O-atom
The carbonyl C-atom and the three atoms attached to it lie in the same plane and π-e– cloud is above and below this plane

questions.description: Which of the following statement is correct :

options.description: The C–O double bond is polarised due to high EN of Oxygen than Carbon
The carbonyl Carbon is an electrophilic (lewis acid) centre and carbonyl oxygen a nucleophilic (Lewis base) centre
The high polarity of the carbonyl group is explained on the base of resonance
